P5l22JvP9Sc.title: EkhartYoga is 10! Thank you from Esther Ekhart
P5l22JvP9Sc.description:
Hi everyone
It’s hard to believe that 2022 marks 10 years since EkhartYoga was born!
It all began here on this YouTube channel and then we set up the EkhartYoga.com website with all our full length classes, guided programs, playlists, articles, practice tips and lots more. 
We know that many of you have been with us from the very start, creating this very special feeling of community.
I'd like to say a huge thank you for your support, love and loyalty and for practicing with us - both online and in person - and for all of your comments and questions. Thank you for believing in us and for letting us be part of your story.
Here's to the next 10 years! 
With love,
Esther x

iFnWmn5qh-s.title: Open Heart Yoga Flow with Esther Ekhart
iFnWmn5qh-s.description:
I'm always amazed by how much you can do and shift in 10 minutes!

In this class... Start low to the floor, with bridge pose pulses for waking up your body's strength. Then some work on all fours to mobilise your spine and bring openness to your heart and upper body. Finish by elevating that mobility and openness into standing poses.

10 minutes well spent - enjoy!

Check out our new 'Zen in 10' yoga program for more bite-sized yoga classes like this: https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/146/zen-in-10

b6ShzRG-g4k.title: Child's pose tutorial with variations (Balasana)
b6ShzRG-g4k.description:
Child's pose (Balasana) is a very common pose in many yoga classes, and is often spoken of as a place to relax. For some of us, however, it might not be that comfortable at all. In this tutorial, we'll explore the many possible variations and modifications you can use to make child's pose work for your body, so that you'll be equipped with the knowledge to support yourself and make this pose as pleasant and safe as possible.

New to yoga? Try Rose's Vinyasa Yoga for Beginners program on EkhartYoga  https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/127/vinyasa-yoga-for-beginners

Our brand new program begins soon - Mindful Morning Yoga with Esther Ekhart on EkhartYoga.com
⁠
Two weeks of classes with Esther Ekhart to kick your days off feeling calm, clear and strong, navigate life more mindfully, and help you get a good night’s sleep!⁠
⁠
Look forward to...⁠
• A new 30-minute, all-level, morning yoga class, sprinkled with Esther’s warm wisdom – every Monday, Wednesday and Friday.
• A combination of dynamic Vinyasa and gentle slow flows for flexibility, strength, energy and focus.⁠
• A bonus breathwork and meditation class to practice in the evenings!⁠

VNN8kn1XU-8.title: Morning mobilisation flow - 21 Mornings with Yoga challenge
VNN8kn1XU-8.description:
This class with Esther Ekhart is the first class of our 21 Mornings with Yoga challenge - 21 days of 20-minute yoga classes to boost your mood, sustain your energy and help you focus: Click here for full details: https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/23/21-mornings-with-yoga
You can sign up for a 14 day free trial on: https://www.ekhartyoga.com to take part in the program today!

In this class, we'll warm up properly and get the chi moving with a short shake out, shoulder rolls and some spinal waves. We'll give some extra attention to the waist area, which when opened may give you a nice, spacious feeling in your body and mind. Also we'll do some work in Goddess pose, which will challenge the legs somewhat to give you that feeling of strength. Next... all you have to do is to enjoy the rest of your day!

Qe7VjSDn3Yg.title: Tensegrity - what is it & how does it help us become more resilient? Webinar with Christine Wushke
Qe7VjSDn3Yg.description:
Check out Christine's courses on the EkhartYoga Academy: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/fascia-nervous-system
https://www.ekhart-academy.com/chronic-pain
Myofascial Yoga for Stress Reduction program: https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/141/myofascial-yoga-for-stress-reduction

Tensegrity is a term combining the words ‘tension’ and ‘integrity’, originally used to describe a structure held in place by tensile and compressive forces. In the human body, it refers to the balance of tension and compression to create strength and stability. The idea is that when tension and compression are in balance, our energy can be used optimally and efficiently and, in turn, this supports our mental and physical resilience.

In this fascinating webinar, Christine explains how we can apply and embody the concepts of tensegrity to our practice, through mindful movement and breath awareness. She’ll also share why myofascial yoga isn’t a style but an approach - one which brings together anatomy, philosophy, breath, lifestyle, and technique and can have a truly profound effect on the relationship we have with our body and how we move through the world.

This webinar was streamed LIVE on 8 February 2022. Sign up to the EkhartYoga Academy newsletter to keep up to date on future live webinars and offers: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/newsletter

00:00 - Intro
03:32 - Webinar
35:37 - Short mindful practice
45:18 - Q&A

The idea is that when tension and compression are in balance, our energy can be used optimally and efficiently and, in turn, this supports our mental and physical resilience.

In this fascinating webinar, Christine explains how we can apply and embody the concepts of tensegrity to our practice, through mindful movement and breath awareness. She’ll also share why myofascial yoga isn’t a style but an approach - one which brings together anatomy, philosophy, breath, lifestyle, and technique and can have a truly profound effect on the relationship we have with our body and how we move through the world.

This webinar was streamed LIVE on 8 February 2022. Sign up to the EkhartYoga Academy newsletter to keep up to date on future live webinars and offers: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/newsletter

In a world that demands more and more of our attention, how do we stay true to our inner compass? fYVYWy15Mco.title: Morning Yoga Pick Me Up with Esther Ekhart
fYVYWy15Mco.description:
This yoga class is the first from our Body Breath Mind program on EkhartYoga.com. https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/137/body-breath-mind where we combine yoga asana, breathwork and meditation in each class.
To continue the program you can take out a free 14-day trial and then select a monthly or annual membership https://www.ekhartyoga.com/pricing

We begin this practice with Agni Sari, the fire breath, to ignite our digestive fire and clear the energy pathways. You might feel blissed out and nicely energised after this breath practice! Next up, a slow flow suitable for the morning, that prepares the joints properly for the poses. With lunges, twists, backbends and a delicious side bend at the end. We finish with a wonderfully grounding and uplifting meditation.

x9l_AX4uD8s.title: Shoulders - explore mobility & stability - Webinar with David Lurey
x9l_AX4uD8s.description:
Check out David's course on the EkhartYoga Academy: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/functional-movement-yoga

Join David for this interactive anatomy and movement session, focusing on the shoulders.

Bound together by connective tissue and a variety of muscles, the shoulder joint has a wide range of mobility offering lots of options for movement - whether you’re weight-bearing or not. While yoga tends to focus on mobility, most functional movement practices focus on stability. In this webinar, we will explore both.

There will be 30 minutes of active practice, followed by 30 minutes of Q&A time.
You’ll need some floor space to roll around.

This webinar was streamed LIVE on 1 September 2021. Don't want to miss out on future live webinars? Sign up to the EkhartYoga Academy newsletter here: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/newsletter

localized.title: Shoulders - explore mobility & stability - Webinar with David Lurey
localized.description:
Check out David's course on the EkhartYoga Academy: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/functional-movement-yoga

Join David for this interactive anatomy and movement session, focusing on the shoulders.

Bound together by connective tissue and a variety of muscles, the shoulder joint has a wide range of mobility offering lots of options for movement - whether you’re weight-bearing or not. While yoga tends to focus on mobility, most functional movement practices focus on stability. In this webinar, we will explore both.

There will be 30 minutes of active practice, followed by 30 minutes of Q&A time.
You’ll need some floor space to roll around.

This webinar was streamed LIVE on 1 September 2021. Don't want to miss out on future live webinars? Sign up to the EkhartYoga Academy newsletter here: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/newsletter

72YIbcYnRKs.title: Help, my child won’t go to sleep! Webinar with Tracey Uber Cook
72YIbcYnRKs.description:
"Yoga-based tools for kids, parents and educators" course is now available on the EkhartYoga Academy: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/yoga-tools-for-kids

Are you the parent of a young child who is struggling to get to sleep at night? Are you finding it difficult to incorporate an effective evening routine? Or have bedtimes become a battleground?

If so, join Tracey Uber Cook for some practical, yoga-based techniques and suggestions that will help you to stay calm when dealing with your defiant / frustrated / exhausted child at bedtime.  

You’ll also come away with some unique tips and insights to help you settle your child’s overactive and over-stimulated system so they are able to relax and go to sleep.

Tracey Uber Cook is an internationally recognised yoga and meditation teacher, with over two decades of experience helping adults and children maintain joy and wellbeing. She is also a mother to two teenagers, a Queensland Program Leader for Yoga Tools for Schools and a facilitator and trainer for the Youth R.E.S.E.T Program.

This webinar was streamed LIVE on 28 July 2021. Don't want to miss out on future live webinars? Sign up to the EkhartYoga Academy newsletter here: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/newsletter

HItRvzUnqKg.description:
Try the full length class here: https://www.ekhartyoga.com/classes/4432/chillax-and-unwind

Join Amy Slevin for this short class for when you're tired and want a brief period of relaxed movement. She'll give you guidelines which you can adapt to your mood or energy level, move as much or as little as you like in this chilled out, soft class. You're invited to be lazy, honour your low energy and feel where your body wants to go.  You might want to dim the lights and put on some relaxing music, it will help you float away as we move gently within positions and between them.

WGmYLwukuAo.title: Forward bends in Yin Yoga - Webinar with José de Groot
WGmYLwukuAo.description:
Yin Yoga and Meridians teacher training: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/yinyogameridianstt
Yin Anatomy teacher training: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/yinanatomytt

Do you have trouble feeling a stretch in your hamstrings when practicing forward bends in Yin yoga? If so, this could be due to the structure and shape of your pelvis and hips, and the way they interact and respond when in flexion.  

José de Groot, our expert Yin teacher, will dive into the anatomy of the hips and pelvis and offer you plenty of pose variations to help you target your hamstrings in your Yin practice. As always, there’ll be a chance to ask questions.

This webinar was streamed LIVE on 13 July 2021. Don't want to miss out on future live webinars? Sign up to the EkhartYoga Academy newsletter here: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/newsletter

dwyZKI4Lexk.title: Sex hormones vs Stress hormones - Webinar and Q&A with Mirjam Wagner
dwyZKI4Lexk.description:
Check out Mirjam's course "Befriend your hormones, balance your life" on EkhartYoga Academy: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/hormones-and-yoga

Most of us know that chronic stress can deplete our health and energy levels. But did you know that when under pressure, our stress hormones also impact our sex hormones?

In this live webinar, Mirjam Wagner will explain the relationship between these two types of hormones. She’ll also share practices and tips to help us replenish and nourish our Yin resources so that we can navigate womanhood with ease and grace.

You will need your mat as Mirjam will teach a short Yin Yoga practice. The webinar will be followed by a Q&A session.

Mirjam is a highly experienced osteopath and yoga teacher. She loves to share her knowledge of Yin yoga, organ health, hormones and the feminine archetypes to empower and support women to connect with themselves deeply and heal from within.
Mirjam combines a scientific understanding of the human body with a holistic and spiritual approach by integrating Meditation, Mindfulness, Chinese Medicine & Buddhism.

This webinar was streamed LIVE on 6 July 2021. Don't want to miss out on future live webinars? Sign up to the EkhartYoga Academy newsletter here: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/newsletter

VoPIznXUQd4.title: Mini power prayer yoga flow - with Anna Sugarman
VoPIznXUQd4.description:
Try the full-length class here: https://www.ekhartyoga.com/classes/4151/power-prayer-flow-2-mind-shine

Join Anna Sugarman for a clarifying and energizing power flow! Articulate the whole spinal column by rolling through cat-cows and vinyasas – a modern twist on the classic flow feels great on the back and looks oh so cool! Clear your head and amp up your vision with this flowy flow designed to encourage you to drop out of your mind, into your physical body. Draw light into the mind's eye, and maintain awareness as you move through a playful, mind-expanding sequence that builds in intensity before winding down.

t-GODgB0vp0.title: Short stress-relieving music flow - with Rose van Ooijen
t-GODgB0vp0.description:
Try Rose's full-length class here: https://www.ekhartyoga.com/classes/4408/musical-stress-relieving-flow

Take a short and sweet relaxing break with this little yoga flow accompanied by the beautiful music graciously offered to us by Fred Westra. We begin and end slowly, with deep belly breathing and relaxing opening movements, really dropping into the body. In the middle, just enough movement to get things open and flowing :) The physical focus is mainly on opening the hips, shoulders and chest - spots where stress has a tendency to build.

If you enjoyed the music, please support Fred at http://www.fredwestra.com/ or listen on Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/artist/3xoBnkqEXHqY8Kl6s2oWHG?si=3kCCmH9fReqkBC0_OGJAFw

iTm1zo_FUDY.title: Ayurveda Webinar and Q&A with Irina Verwer
iTm1zo_FUDY.description:
Check out Irina's course "Fundamentals of Ayurveda" on EkhartYoga Academy: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/fundamentals-ayurveda
Or "Ayurveda for Pregnancy": https://www.ekhart-academy.com/ayurveda-pregnancy

Though the start of Summer in the Northern hemisphere brings longer, brighter days, you may notice yourself feeling a little more rushed - or even irritated - than usual. You may find yourself craving interaction with others more than you normally would. Maybe you’re experiencing headaches or digestive issues?

In this live webinar, Irina will explain which Ayurvedic dosha causes these imbalances. You'll learn more about what Ayurveda is and how to apply its wisdom to bring yourself back to balance, so that you can enjoy the Summer and be ready for whatever the rest of the year brings.

This webinar was streamed LIVE on 15 June 2021. Don't want to miss out on future live webinars? Sign up to the EkhartYoga Academy newsletter here: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/newsletter

A9JaW0edQxY.title: Nurture your connection with goodness - Global Meditation with Esther Ekhart
A9JaW0edQxY.description:
Join Esther for class 3 of our Global Meditation program. You can still sign up for two more weeks of free live meditations on EkhartYoga.com: https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/132/global-meditation-together-we-grow

This meditation begins by inviting us to look for the acts of kindness, compassion and love in the world and in others - an act that softens and opens our heart. We’ll then draw this sense of open-heartedness gently back to our centre to connect with the core of our own goodness.

About our Global Meditation program: 
🌳 Every Monday we’ll come together as a community for a live class to meditate - to awaken, connect and grow. The classes are on ekhartyoga.com
🌳 Each meditation will be free for 24 hours. So if you're not an EkhartYoga member you can still take part. 
🌳 We’ll plant a tree for everyone who joins us live via our partners https://treesisters.org/about/tree-st...
We encourage you to invite your friends and family to join and create a global movement. Let’s unite and grow a forest together while sending love and compassion out into the world!
❤ Since we planned this program the second wave of COVID in India has escalated dramatically. For every new member who joins during this program we'll be donating 50% of their first month's membership to Give India's COVID relief fund
https://covid.giveindia.org/

hLiMrq9lLzk.description:
As we practice yoga, we often get caught up in what we think we should be doing and what we believe our poses should look like, instead of simply feeling. In this practice, Laia encourages you to do just that, let go of expectations and allow yourself to move and breathe freely, exploring what comes up and enjoying the process!

mywR16tXMk4.title: Hip Anatomy & Movement - Webinar replay with David Lurey
mywR16tXMk4.description:
Check out David's course "Expanding Horizons" on the EkhartYoga Academy: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/functional-movement-yoga

Join David for this interactive anatomy and movement session, focusing on the hips. He’ll begin with an overview of the bones and muscles in the hips. He’ll then guide a short yoga practice to isolate and experience the movements of these bones and muscles. Then, we will ‘expand our horizons’ by incorporating different movements and non-yoga poses to gain a more integrated experience of the hips that reflects and supports their use in daily life. After the practice, there’ll be a 30 minute Q&A session.

You will need some floor space and a yoga mat for the practice.

Streamed LIVE on 11 May 2021. Don't want to miss out on future live webinars? Sign up to the EkhartYoga Academy newsletter here: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/newsletter

https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/132/global-meditation-together-we-grow

 https://www.ekhartyoga.com/newsletter-signup

About our upcoming Global Meditation program: 
🌳 Every Monday we’ll come together as a community for a live class to meditate - to awaken, connect and grow. The classes are on ekhartyoga.com

We encourage you to invite your friends and family to join and create a global movement. Let’s unite and grow a forest together while sending love and compassion out into the world!

zMxiok2jFp4.title: 10 minute yoga to release tension in the neck and shoulders
zMxiok2jFp4.description:
Try also - https://www.ekhartyoga.com/classes/4308/unzoom-your-eyes-neck-and-upper-back

We all have times where we are under a lot of pressure and stress. For many of us it can often lead to tension in our neck and shoulders that some simple neck rolls just won't shift.
This short practice will offer you a few yoga exercises that will help you release tension and stiffness in the neck and shoulders. You'll also learn about the connection between the eye muscles and the neck!
Always be gentle with your body. These movements should feel good! If you experience pain or discomfort it's sign to take it a little easier and not go so far with the movements.

_IV_hknMFrM.title: Relaxing Yoga Nidra with James Reeves
_IV_hknMFrM.description:
Check out James' Yoga Nidra Teacher Training course on the EkhartYoga Academy: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/yoganidra-teachertraining
You can also practice more Yoga Nidra classes with James on EkhartYoga.com: https://www.ekhartyoga.com/teachers/james-reeves

In this class, James Reeves will teach you out of the tradition of Yoga Nidra. He will guide you through body sensations and the breath, and make some space for thoughts, feelings and images that might surface from the subconscious mind. By the end, you will hopefully settle back into the stillness of who you really are.

Make yourself comfortable, and get ready to feel rested, content and relaxed.

VMo-XRfax34.title: Yin Yoga and Wood Element - Webinar replay with José de Groot
VMo-XRfax34.description:
Check out José's Yin Yoga & Meridians Teacher Training course on the EkhartYoga Academy here: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/yinyogameridianstt
José's Yin Anatomy Teacher Training course is also available here:  https://www.ekhart-academy.com/yinanatomytt

As we move into Spring, the period associated with Wood energy according to Traditional Chinese Medicine, we invite you to learn more about this fascinating subject.

The Wood element enters its phase on the first day of Spring, and evokes the expansive moment of birth and growth, of coming alive after the cold and quiet days of Winter. It is a strong and potent energy, capable of breaking through the harsh shell of a seed and pushing its way up through the soil to bask in the sunlight.

In Chinese Five Elements theory, 'Wood' is associated with the organs and meridians Liver and Gallbladder.

Join José de Groot for a 30 minute talk on this fascinating topic, followed by a Q&A session. She’ll also teach some Yin Yoga poses which target the Liver and Gallbladder meridians to harmonize elemental energies for physical, mental and emotional wellbeing.

José specializes in teaching Yin Yoga and anatomy. Her passion for teaching functional and holistic yoga is fueled by her own continued study and practice in functional anatomy, Yin and Yang yoga, Chinese medicine, philosophy, and psychology.

Streamed LIVE on 24 March 2021. Don't want to miss out on future live webinars? Sign up to the EkhartYoga Academy newsletter here: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/newsletter

a3Sx9VrUYwE.title: Yin Yoga and Hips Anatomy - Webinar replay with José de Groot
a3Sx9VrUYwE.description:
Check out José's Yin Anatomy Teacher Training course on the EkhartYoga Academy: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/yinanatomytt
José's Yin Yoga & Meridians Teacher Training course is also available here: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/yinyogameridianstt

Do you find it challenging to do certain Yin poses that require ‘open’ hips? What do we mean by ‘hip opening’ anyway? In this webinar, you’ll learn that it’s not just tension that restricts your range of movement but compression due to skeletal variations.  

Join José de Groot for a free, 30 minute talk on this fascinating topic, followed by a Q&A session.

José specializes in teaching Yin Yoga and anatomy. Her passion for teaching functional and holistic yoga is fueled by her own continued study and practice in functional anatomy, Yin and Yang yoga, Chinese medicine, philosophy, and psychology.

Streamed LIVE on 17 February 2021. Don't want to miss out on future live webinars? Sign up to the EkhartYoga Academy newsletter here: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/newsletter

qZ2R9LBry4Q.title: Liberate - LIVE class with Esther Ekhart for Yoga Stops Traffick
qZ2R9LBry4Q.description:
https://www.yogastopstraffick.org/donations/

Join Esther for a liberating, heart opening, 60-minute flow – concluding with a loving kindness meditation. Streaming LIVE on 14th March at 18:00 CET. There will be options for all levels and everyone is welcome!

We are honoured to host this special event to support Yoga Stops Traffick in uniting yoga practitioners around the globe to help raise awareness and vital funds for survivors of human trafficking in India.
Yoga has allowed survivors to reclaim their bodies, build physical and mental strength, and restore peace, confidence and self-worth. Every year, together with Yoga Stops Traffick, thousands of yoga practitioners worldwide roll out their mats to stand in solidarity.

Please roll out your mat. Your practice is enough. You’re also invited to send love and light – or donations: https://www.yogastopstraffick.org/donations/
Funds raised go to Odanadi Seva Trust in Mysore — to help rescue and rehabilitate survivors of human trafficking, sexual and domestic violence, modern-day slavery and child marriage.  
#YST2021

J-8OihB_dok.title: Powerfully Present - LIVE check-in with Esther Ekhart
J-8OihB_dok.description:
We're half-way through our new yoga program, Powerfully Present https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/124/powerfully-present
On 14 January 17:00 CET, Esther will offer a 30 minute session to check-in and reflect on the program so far.

At the start of the new year, it’s natural to want to bid farewell to the old and usher in the new. And after such a challenging year, who can blame us?! Planning, setting goals and resolutions can give us a sense of purpose and hope.

Although this may be beneficial to a degree, the underlying message that we’re also giving ourselves is that we’re not quite happy/perfect now but we will be in the future when ‘something’ is different.

This year we’d like to invite you to do things a little differently. Instead of entering the New Year with the wish to change ourselves or our current circumstances, we’d like to teach you how to be deeply present with your reality. Because learning to be with ‘what is’ is an act that can bring about genuine peace.

You can still join the program here: https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/124/powerfully-present
The first class is free, and new members can enjoy a two week free trial.

qdvqxTkVYB4.title: Powerfully Present - LIVE introduction with Esther Ekhart
qdvqxTkVYB4.description:
Join Esther Ekhart for a LIVE introduction to our new yoga program, Powerfully Present https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/124/powerfully-present

At the start of the new year, it’s natural to want to bid farewell to the old and usher in the new. And after such a challenging year, who can blame us?! Planning, setting goals and resolutions can give us a sense of purpose and hope.

Although this may be beneficial to a degree, the underlying message that we’re also giving ourselves is that we’re not quite happy/perfect now but we will be in the future when ‘something’ is different.

This year we’d like to invite you to do things a little differently. Instead of entering the New Year with the wish to change ourselves or our current circumstances, we’d like to teach you how to be deeply present with your reality. Because learning to be with ‘what is’ is an act that can bring about genuine peace.

You can join the program here: https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/124/powerfully-present
The first class is free, and new members can enjoy a two week free trial.

- - - - - - - - - -

eV3Ozy4V_N4.title: LIVE webinar replay - Yin Yoga and Meridians with José de Groot
eV3Ozy4V_N4.description:
Check out José's Yin Yoga and Meridians Teacher Training course on the EkhartYoga Academy here: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/yinyogameridianstt.

The concepts of Chi and Meridians can be difficult to grasp. However, this knowledge can transform your Yin yoga practice (and teaching) into a powerful, holistic wellness tool.
In this online webinar, our expert Yin Yoga teacher, José de Groot, explains these concepts and why the application of them can enrich the experience of Yin Yoga. She also shares some basic Yin Yoga sequencing principles to target specific meridians and harmonize elemental energies for physical, mental and emotional wellbeing. Towards the end, José will give some information about the metal element and answer some questions.

Streamed LIVE on 5 November 2020. Don't want to miss out on future live webinars? Sign up to the EkhartYoga Academy newsletter here: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/newsletter

G7dOghTS03k.title: Seeing Clearly - Eye Yoga with Tracey Cook
G7dOghTS03k.description:
Please sign up to our newsletter for free classes, EkhartYoga news and offers: https://www.ekhartyoga.com/newsletter-signup

In this class, Tracey Cook shows us how to practice yoga for the eyes. Our eyes provide us with the opportunity to view the spectacular world around us. Their function is affected not only by poor lighting quality and excess screen time, but also by the amount of internal tension we hold in our bodies. It is important to remember our eyes when taking care of ourselves; to consciously relax them, exercise them and show them the same care that we show the rest of ourselves in our yoga practice.

After being diagnosed with glaucoma, Tracey realised how important it is to take care of our eyes. We hope you find this class helpful. Read  more in Tracey's article
https://www.ekhartyoga.com/articles/wellbeing/yoga-and-glaucoma

TUM4uSTo17k.title: What's up with the Psoas? | Psoas muscle tutorial with Sandra Carson
TUM4uSTo17k.description:
More yoga classes for the psoas muscle with Sandra on EkhartYoga: https://www.ekhartyoga.com/playlists/1373/the-magical-psoas-muscle
In this short talk you will have some answers to the question "why is the psoas muscle so important"? A tight psoas might be a cause of factor in your back pain, sleep quality and even your digestion! After this tutorial, you will also know how to safely actively stretch your psoas in one of the most common yoga poses.

AQfjTAxUSv0.title: LIVE Webinar - The Art of Sequencing with Esther Ekhart
AQfjTAxUSv0.description:
Thoughtful and structured sequencing is the secret behind a well balanced and inspiring yoga class.

Whether you are a yoga teacher looking for inspiration or a yoga practitioner seeking inspiration, understanding key principles of sequencing will help you gain a stronger foundation from which your teaching and self-practice can flourish.

Esther Ekhart will share some of those principles, rooted in her experience during a live webinar on Thursday September 10th, 17:00 CET. There will also be a chance to ask Esther any questions during the Q&A session.

frb3awQBTyg.title: Tripod Headstand Tutorial with Anna Sugarman
frb3awQBTyg.description:
See Anna's latest classes on EkhartYoga.com https://www.ekhartyoga.com/teachers/anna-sugarman
This playful little yoga tutorial is for anyone wishing to develop their tripod headstand practice. A step by step cruise from earth to sky – with a funky asymmetric variation and an option to tip your headstand into crow and back again. High five! This is for yogis who are already practicing Headstands in class with a teacher. Not suitable if you have any neck or shoulder issues or if you have you have been advised not to do inversions (when your head is below your heart) due to blood pressure or glaucoma. Please take responsibility for your own body and if in doubt seek medical advice first.

lrSUq7fe_Sw.title: LIVE Webinar - Anat Geiger's Introduction to Patanjali’s Yoga Sutras
lrSUq7fe_Sw.description:
I am always amazed at how relevant the yoga texts and concepts are with regards to making our lives easier, better and happier. More than ever these days, I see how a lack of a philosophy leaves people feeling lost and desperately in search of meaning and purpose.

Patanjali is especially efficient at providing us with inspiration and hope; we just need to unpack his message a little and translate it to our reality and times. During this talk we will look into some of these helpful ideas, and hopefully find the thread the holds our spirit together.

*** For more information on Anat's course, please visit https://www.ekhart-academy.com/patanjalis-sutras1 ***

lF5YowJZRAM.title: Fundamentals of Ayurveda course with Irina Verwer
lF5YowJZRAM.description:
New Academy course launches today: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/fundamentals-ayurveda
Early bird discount before 17th August
Learn the fundamental principles of Ayurveda with Irina Verwer. 

This 4-hour online course is packed full of information to give you a strong grounding in the concepts of Ayurveda, including its origins, the elements, what Doshas are and how to recognise when they're out of balance. 

You'll learn self-care tools and techniques (including dietary advice, self-massage, yoga practices) to support you throughout your life, no matter what the circumstances are.

Last but not least, you'll also get free access to yoga classes, Irina's cookbook AND 20% off the course if you purchase it before Monday 17th Aug.😊

Just type in EARLYBIRD20 at checkout.

X5x7Ybluecw.title: Experiencing body, breath and mind - 15 minute meditation with Tracey Cook
X5x7Ybluecw.description:
https://www.ekhartyoga.com/teachers/tracey-uber-cook 
Yoga can be defined as: the great union of body, breath, mind, spirit, in harmony with the Earth, all cosmic energies, and the Universe ... and the magnificent merging of each individual self with the Grand Divine Totality of All Life. It is ever-present within each and every one of us, comprising guiding and surrounding each and every moment. In this 15 minute meditation, we explore and body, breath and mind, as well as becoming familiar with the part of ourselves that is the “experiencer” of the body, breath, mind, and all of the experiences in our lives.

9azvvxkluX0.title: Sitting all day? Strengthen your butt, your core and so much more - with Esther Ekhart
9azvvxkluX0.description:
When you're sitting all day for work your butt muscles - glutes - can get lazy. This can lead to lower back pain amongst other things. So try this short class with some fun poses that will get your butt working and strong. Really helpful when you sit a lot with work and to help any back issues. 
Read our tips for looking after your body when you're working from home: https://www.ekhartyoga.com/articles/wellbeing/looking-after-your-body-while-youre-working-from-home
If you want more butt and core fun like this try this class on EkhartYoga.com

Yr1fKJbk63Q.title: Energy 101: Self-care in challenging times program - EkhartYoga with Rose van Ooijen
Yr1fKJbk63Q.description:
https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/119/energy-101-self-care-in-challenging-times
With everything that is going on in the world and in many of our personal lives, it can be helpful to take a little more time for self-care and understand some of the influences that the current global energies might be having on us. This video is a short outline of our 3 part video series Energy 101 on EkhartYoga.com. The program includes talks and meditations on First Aid in a Crisis, Finding Balance and Thriving.
Among other things, we will be talking about:
•        There is more to our world than meets the eye
•        Everything has a frequency!
•        The huge polarities currently residing in our collective 
•        Energy and thoughts are, in a way, contagious
•        The importance of becoming mindful of what you consume! Not only physically, but mentally, emotionally, energetically. Media, relationships, conversations
•        Why to check in with yourself during the day, and being aware of how you feel
•        Cultivating compassion to yourself and to others
•        Tools to neutralise 
•        Living inside out vs outside in
•        You can choose to be the anchor for what you want to have grow in the world 
https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/119/energy-101-self-care-in-challenging-times
- - - - - - - - - - 
Not an EkhartYoga member? Register for your free 14 day trial to follow this program with Rose
https://ekhartyoga.com/register
Along with this program you can choose from thousands of classes and programs in different yoga styles. From mini-tutorials through to full length classes, for yoga beginners to advanced.

zQc0jSlLd9w.title: Downward Dog Basics with Esther Ekhart
zQc0jSlLd9w.description:
This tutorial gives information about the different alignment tips, beginner tips and the benefits of Downward Facing Dog pose. You can read more about the pose on the website https://www.ekhartyoga.com/resources/yoga-poses/downward-facing-dog-pose
But most of all it invites an exploration within your own body to feel what works and doesn't, so you can find the variation of the pose work that works for your body. I hope that everyone can find this useful for your own practice and for your students if you are a yoga teacher.
- - - - - - - - - -

Please subscribe to the channel to join me and our EkhartYoga community around the world to meet and meditate together.
This class was live on March 23rd 2020 and we talked about how peace lies within.

This class includes gentle exercises to free energy in the body and a loving kindness meditation to settle the mind and energy system.

L0IsjticFUk.title: What is stopping or restricting you in yoga poses?
L0IsjticFUk.description:
https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/114/functional-yoga-program  
Anat Geiger talks through the two main physical reasons you might not be able to do certain yoga poses in the traditional alignment. Tension and Compression.

Tension is a physical restriction which could be tightness in your muscles and fascia. This is something that can be worked on to a certain extent through practice.

Compression is where two parts of the body are meeting each other - bone meeting bone. Compression means that you have reached the end range of movement possible for your bone structure.

So then we look at how to practice yoga poses in a way that works best for our own unique body and bone structure, taking into consideration both what we can change through practice (tension) and what we can’t (compression). 

Learn how to put this in practice with Esther Ekhart, Anat Geiger and Marcel van de Vis Heil in our Functional Yoga Program on EkhartYoga.com - starts February 17th.
3 teachers bringing you our own perspective on Functional Yoga. 
You can take out a two-week trial and try us for free.

#functionalyoga #yoga #anatgeiger

Please subscribe to this channel for regular free yoga videos
http://www.youtube.com/EkhartYoga

Batc2LhOAEQ.title: How to make yoga poses functional
Batc2LhOAEQ.description:
https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/114/functional-yoga-program  
Marcel van de Vis Heil talks us through some questions to ask when you’re practicing yoga or sequencing yoga classes as a teacher. 
What area of the body are we working on? What’s our target area?
What are we trying to do with the pose? Is it to strengthen that target area or to stretch or open it? 

When we start with these two questions we are thinking of yoga in a more functional way and can then see if we need to adapt the yoga pose so that we are meeting these aims. For example, if we include chair pose / utkatasana in a class to strengthen the quads, would we do this more efficiently if we brought the feet wider into more of a squat position? 

Learn how to put this in practice with Esther Ekhart, Anat Geiger and Marcel van de Vis Heil in our Functional Yoga Program on EkhartYoga.com - starts February 17th.
3 teachers bringing you our own perspective on Functional Yoga. 
You can take out a two-week trial and try us for free.

localized.title: How to make yoga poses functional
localized.description:
https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/114/functional-yoga-program  
Marcel van de Vis Heil talks us through some questions to ask when you’re practicing yoga or sequencing yoga classes as a teacher. 
What area of the body are we working on? What’s our target area?
What are we trying to do with the pose? Is it to strengthen that target area or to stretch or open it? 

When we start with these two questions we are thinking of yoga in a more functional way and can then see if we need to adapt the yoga pose so that we are meeting these aims. For example, if we include chair pose / utkatasana in a class to strengthen the quads, would we do this more efficiently if we brought the feet wider into more of a squat position? 

Learn how to put this in practice with Esther Ekhart, Anat Geiger and Marcel van de Vis Heil in our Functional Yoga Program on EkhartYoga.com - starts February 17th.
3 teachers bringing you our own perspective on Functional Yoga. 
You can take out a two-week trial and try us for free.

sQbaPKPtWd4.title: What is Functional Yoga?
sQbaPKPtWd4.description:
https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/114/functional-yoga-program  
Join me with Anat and Marcel in our 3 week Functional Yoga Program on EkhartYoga.com and learn to adapt yoga for your own body.

You might have already heard the term Functional Yoga but what does it mean? In short it’s about putting your attention on what is the effect we want from this pose instead of what it looks like. So we’re valuing function over form.

When we talk about practicing yoga in a functional way we can think of it in terms of three questions:
1 What is the function of the pose? What target area in the body are we working on? And are we trying to strengthen or stretch it? 

2 What’s stopping or restricting the pose? Is it a physical restriction which could be tightness in your muscles and fascia (tension) or bone meeting bone (compression)? Or is the restriction due to emotional or energetic blocks? Or a combination?

3 How can you change the pose to make it work for your body? 
Either through physical ways like adjusting the shape of the pose. Or emotional or energetic ways like freeing stuck energy with shaking, breathwork and tuning into your body. 

Join me Esther Ekhart, Anat Geiger and Marcel van de Vis Heil in our Functional Yoga Program on EkhartYoga.com - starts February 17th.
3 teachers bringing you our own perspective on Functional Yoga. 
https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/114/functional-yoga-program  

You can take out a two-week trial and try us for free.

dDucmm4uEZY.description:
Esther Ekhart talks with yoga educator, Leslie Kaminoff. They discuss:
- The changing face of yoga and how it’s always been evolving. 
- Breath and alignment instructions and to what extent these are still helpful to both students and teachers. 
- The difference between instructing techniques and offering your students enquiries 
And Leslie shares his three major takeaways for yoga teachers that we all need to hear!

DuSixdrBK_c.title: Groovy little flow
DuSixdrBK_c.description:
A wonderfully compact full yoga practice: you don't need a lot of time to get the full benefits of Yoga! Groove into this flow and experience the length of your spine, moving into Trikonasana (triangle pose) and a balance pose. Feel alive and centered as you come back to the floor to enjoy a lovely moving twist, mindfully coming back to your centre, grateful for the time you have given yourself today to feel great!

JKr3kO3wNuc.title: 10 minute Shiva Shakti yoga flow | Move the spine and feel fine | EkhartYoga
JKr3kO3wNuc.description:
This is a lovely yoga sequence that you can do everywhere, you don't even need a yoga mat. It is a standing sequence (so wrist friendly) and helps to make the spine more flexible with a forward and backbend flow and also a side bend stretch. I hope you enjoy it, if you'd like to know the full sequence, please tune in to EkhartYoga.com. This ancient yoga sequence comes from the North of India where they call it the Dance of Shiva and Shakti. I learned it from Peter Clifford my teacher who lived in the mountains for more then 30 years. I hope you enjoy it. Namastè, Afke.
#vinyasaflow #freeyoga #morningyoga

c_r4ZQID2cA.title: 20 minute eagles and twists yoga flow with Anna Sugarman | EkhartYoga
c_r4ZQID2cA.description:
Enjoy a 20 minute fun yoga flow which opens the hips and upper back. Twist and turn in Eagle pose (Garudasana) and float with the breath. A seated meditation inspires peace and leads into a seamless vinyasa flow with a fresh spin including skaters pose (Skandasana) with eagle arms, shoulderstand with eagle legs, and some cozy time in Vishnu's Couch. https://www.ekhartyoga.com/classes/3594/eagles-and-twists

kToyHVagvmE.title: 30 minute Yin yoga class for inner peace - in support of IMOVE
kToyHVagvmE.description:
You’ll be led through a breath-focused Yin yoga class that will help you to stay present and peaceful in your body and mind.
This is the first class from Esther Ekhart's online program, Declutter your mind with Yin Yoga.
Available for all EkhartYoga members or free during your 2-week trial if you are new to EkhartYoga.
Find out more: https://www.ekhartyoga.com/articles/practice/declutter-your-mind-yin-yoga-program

Esther Ekhart is offering this Yin yoga class on International Day of Yoga, to support the mission of IMOVE. The IMOVE Foundation promote yoga and mindfulness among Syrian refugees, to enhance their resilience and emotional well-being.If you enjoyed the class and have the means, please consider making a donation to support the foundation’s work at https://www.imovefoundation.org

For access to over 3500 online yoga classes please visit our website: https://www.EkhartYoga.com

kYCHXi6JaqU.description:

kghdE-_r6rg.title: The Great Rejuvenator pose - Restorative yoga
kghdE-_r6rg.description:
For full-length yoga classes and courses please visit our website: https://www.EkhartYoga.com
Lisa Petersen shows how turning the body upside down puts us in a position where it's easier to exhale. This in turn deepens our inhale as the body receives the message that all is well. Use the Great Rejuvenator to combat stress, anxiety or tiredness and speed recovery from illness. Use it to help asthma and bronchitis, reduce congestion in the lungs and drain fluids. Also great for sleep difficulties. 

Subscribe to our channel: https://www.youtube.com/EkhartYoga

ucwOARv8plI.title: Aad Guray Nameh: Mantra chanting to the Guru with guitar chords
ucwOARv8plI.description:
Chant along with David Lurey from https://www.EkhartYoga.com to this beautiful mantra from the Kundalini Yoga tradition.  

Aad Guray Nameh
Jugaad Guray Nameh
Sad Guray Nameh
Siri Gurudev Nameh

I bow to the primal Guru
I bow to the truth that has existed through the ages
I bow to the True Guru, the identity of the self
I bow to the great guru whose glory will always be!

A / D / A
F#m / D / A
F#m / D / A
F#m / E / A

Find a beautiful recorded version with David singing here:
http://www.findbalance.net/product/aad-guray-nameh/

XfTNhMXDSB4.title: EkhartYoga Bloopers! The best of our yoga video out-takes
XfTNhMXDSB4.description:
Even the best yoga teachers fluff their lines sometimes! Enjoy some of our favourite out-takes from filming yoga classes this year at https://www.EkhartYoga.com 

9 times out of 10 everything goes nice and smoothly with filming at EkhartYoga. The teacher has their class planned and ready, the technology is working ok, everyone’s feeling in control of it all. 
And then there are those days when... it just doesn’t! ;)

So to round off 2018 with a smile, here are a few of our favourite out-takes from the year. Wishing you all a very happy, healthy and playful 2019 from everyone at EkhartYoga!

K6MSimn8TN0.title: Your body is talking to you, are you listening?
K6MSimn8TN0.description:
Your body is talking to you, are you listening? Investigate and experiment with your daily rhythm and ask yourself: “Is it working for me?” Learn why working with your rhythm is so important: https://www.ekhartyoga.com/articles/practice/find-your-yoga-rhythm

A quick talk from Esther to introduce Find your Yoga Rhythm - an exploration into your yoga practice on EkhartYoga.com. We invite you to investigate and experiment with your personal yoga practice rhythm. When we truly listen to our body and work with our natural rhythms, we begin to feel more energetic, productive, rested and balanced. We invite you to choose the class that fits your mood and energy levels. With your classes, you will also have some questions for reflection to help you in the process. Find out more about how to join in here: https://www.ekhartyoga.com/articles/practice/find-your-yoga-rhythm

ynvLqw9JaGw.title: Thank you - Gratitude meditation practice with the chakras
ynvLqw9JaGw.description:
For full-length yoga classes and courses please visit our website: https://www.EkhartYoga.com

'Thank you' are very powerful words. They express gratitude and energetically this neutralises. We are using these words while focusing on our chakras.
The chakras work as funnels that distribute the gratitude energy throughout your entire energy body. If you can keep your attention and intention on this practice it can create a create shift. Practise regularly for a period of time, if you feel density, stress or tension in your body. With this practice often comes the realization that even the hard and unpleasant situations in life have made us better and stronger in some ways. Even though we find it hard to see or accept sometimes.

7davgfLwWzY.title: 40 minute yoga class to relax your shoulders and neck with Esther Ekhart
7davgfLwWzY.description:
Please visit our website https://www.EkhartYoga.com for lots more yoga for your shoulders and neck
A lovely 40 min sequence that will help to relieve tension in your shoulders and neck that many of us carry due to long days in front of our computers and devices. 
Also included is a short self massage with 2 tennis balls after a proper warm up of the upper body. If you don't have 2 tennis balls you can just skip over this part, and follow the rest of the class. Super worth it! You'll feel so much more free in body and mind after. Enjoy!

9O2dqZD_ATo.title: Wisdom Mantra - Om Mani Padme Hum
9O2dqZD_ATo.description:
This grounding mantra chanting practice with Tashi Dawa uses an age-old Buddhist mantra 'Om Mani Padme Hum'. 
For lots more yoga and meditation classes please visit: https://www.EkhartYoga.com

'Om' as vastness and scope, 'Mani' the jewel of our generosity. 'Padme' our wisdom mind and 'Hum' grounding our practice. 
Tashi grew up using this mantra as a guide to recognise innate wisdom and generosity. Her mother was a student of Lama Yeshe in the 70's and until his passing in the mid 80's. You could start this mantra practice with this video support then keep it going in your own time.

HIhP7UY4jKU.title: How to adapt yoga poses for the shape of your groin
HIhP7UY4jKU.description:
For full-length yoga classes and courses please visit our website: https://www.EkhartYoga.com

The shape of the bony, protruding part on the front of our hips can vary hugely can vary from person to person and compression of this area may create pain or sensitivity in the groin (the area between your leg and pelvis) when doing certain yoga poses. In this video you'll find some yoga poses which may cause this sensation, along with suggestions of how the pose can be adapted to suit your body type.

You can read more about all this in my article 
https://www.ekhartyoga.com/articles/tension-versus-compression-in-yoga

ERQpjI3FKmM.title: Letting go of your motivation to practise yoga - Beyond The Pill
ERQpjI3FKmM.description:
https://www.EkhartYoga.com Join us and practise yoga and meditation with top international teachers.

In this Yoga Philosophy talk, David Dodd discusses how many of us practise yoga to 'fix' something - whether that's stress, illness or for general wellbeing. While all motivations for practising yoga are good, what is key is that we learn to drop our motivations when we roll out our mat. This allows the space for yoga to work it's magic.

OvR_ht7nYzY.title: Join David Lurey and the ShivaSamba band for a fun Kirtan
OvR_ht7nYzY.description:
Join David Lee Lurey and the ShivaSamba band during this Kirtan.
For those who would like to sing along, we’ve added the text below:

Gam Ganapataye Namo Namah
Ganesha Namah Om (3x)
Jay Jay Ganesha

Om Mane Padme Hum

Om Hrim Namah Shivaya Tas Maye Shri Gurave Namaha

Asato Ma Sad Gamaya
Tamaso Ma Jyotir Gamaya
Mrityorma Amritam Gamaya

Your Sweet Love Surrounds Me
In your strength I have faith
Would you lead me and guide me
It feels so warm in your grace

Jay Ma Jay Ma Jay Ma Jay Ma
Jagatambe Jay Jay Ma

2RN6pSELLXc.title: Yoga to help tech neck and rounded shoulders
2RN6pSELLXc.description:
Here are four simple yoga techniques to help counteract ‘tech neck’ that you can incorporate very easily into your day.

For a playlist of classes to help undo a day at the desk visit:  https://www.ekhartyoga.com/playlists/7891/yoga-for-the-desk-bound

Too much time spent on our computers, phones or laptop can result in poor posture. Commonly termed as ‘tech neck’, the chin juts forward so that the weight of the head is no longer supported by the spinal column. The chest also collapses, which brings weight onto the organs in the belly. ‘Tech neck’ therefore doesn’t just cause tension and pain in our neck, it has an impact on everything below this area, even our hips and knees.

Esther talks about the HYOID bone in the neck in the first exercise -

_HR-jOsAygo.title: Zen 10
_HR-jOsAygo.description:
When time is at a premium, busy days, busy lives, it can be difficult to make yoga part of your day. With this in mind, 'zen 10' is a short and simple practice to bring you into your body and into the present, a brief respite from a busy day. Using a short meditation, grounding Hatha standing postures and a supine twist bring quality and space back into your day with this rewarding practice.
Read about the history and philosophy of Hatha Yoga https://www.ekhartyoga.com/articles/philosophy/what-is-hatha-yoga

753BQVL1pmw.description:
https://www.EkhartYoga.com
This set of exercises takes your shoulders through their full range of rotation, which is important to do regularly to ensure the longevity of your functional movement and to avoid injury. 
These movements also bring a lovely sense of openness to the front of the body. You might need a belt or scarf for these exercises.

TvK1mhxQ2Rk.title: Integrating pranayama into your asana practice
TvK1mhxQ2Rk.description:
https://www.ekhartyoga.com

Most of the times we practice asana and pranayama apart, sometimes it is interesting to integrate a deep pranayama practice into the asana practice,m forward bends are good poses to calm down the mind and use the physical asana to add some specific pranayama techniques. Find space, quietness and clarity with this deep practice. If you are a beginner and don't do a headstand, you can do a childspose while a headstand is being held. 

Subscribe to our channel: www.youtube.com/EkhartYoga

L0JdrOIiKjw.title: Yoga anatomy: The hip socket
L0JdrOIiKjw.description:
https://www.ekhartyoga.com     https://www.ekhart-academy.com/anatomy-immersion
In this yoga anatomy talk, we get a quick insight into the structure of the hip socket.

Jennilee talks about the importance of putting closed hip poses sequenced together as well as open hip poses to reduce wear and tear in the hip socket. 

To learn more about safe yoga transitions read Jennilee's article: https://www.ekhartyoga.com/articles/practice/vinyasa-flow-transitions-and-how-to-safely-navigate-them
Yoga teachers - study anatomy online with Jennilee - https://www.ekhart-academy.com/anatomy-immersion

Ya4dEdKnChw.title: Yoga Anatomy - Anatomical insight into the sacroiliac joint
Ya4dEdKnChw.description:
https://www.ekhartyoga.com

Jennilee turns her focus onto the SI joint - a strong, fibrously connective joint at the base of the spine and an area which many of us experience instability in. Jennilee teaches us the importance of allowing the sacrum to follow the spine and the ilium to follow the sacrum in twists such as Revolved Triangle and Twisted chair pose and seated twists, to keep this area safe in our yoga practice. 

If you're a yoga teacher and would like to learn more about anatomy, you can do so with Jennilee Toner on our EkhartYoga Academy. Check out her course here: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/anatomy-immersion

localized.description:
https://www.ekhartyoga.com

Jennilee turns her focus onto the SI joint - a strong, fibrously connective joint at the base of the spine and an area which many of us experience instability in. Jennilee teaches us the importance of allowing the sacrum to follow the spine and the ilium to follow the sacrum in twists such as Revolved Triangle and Twisted chair pose and seated twists, to keep this area safe in our yoga practice. 

If you're a yoga teacher and would like to learn more about anatomy, you can do so with Jennilee Toner on our EkhartYoga Academy. Check out her course here: https://www.ekhart-academy.com/anatomy-immersion

Yg6Y5SMwp7M.title: #6 Dharana - The Eight Limbs of Yoga
Yg6Y5SMwp7M.description:
https://www.ekhartyoga.com
Dharana is the practice of one-pointed focus on an object, breath or sound. It is where we train the mind to concentrate and not go off in a million different directions, jumping from thought to thought, reacting, commenting and judging... When we are able to 'master' the mind, we are prepared for meditation.

i1hXvqw9zo4.title: #2 Niyamas - Esther Ekhart on the Eight Limbs of Yoga
i1hXvqw9zo4.description:
In this short talk, Esther gives an overview of the Niyamas. The Niyamas describe actions and attitudes that we should cultivate to overcome the illusion of separation and the suffering it causes. The five Niyamas are: purity (Saucha); contentment (Santosa); austerity (Tapas); self-study (Svadhyaya); and devotion to the Lord (Isvara Pranidhana). 

This talk is part of the 8 Limbs of Yoga program on https://www.EkhartYoga.com

If you want to know more about the 8 Limbs of Yoga, have a look here: https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/the-eight-limbs-of-yoga

j-h3h8ib8jk.title: #1 - The Yamas  - Eight Limbs of Yoga
j-h3h8ib8jk.description:
The Yamas are primarily concerned with the world around us and our interaction with it.  By considering these aspects in our daily practice on and off the yoga mat, all of our decisions and actions come from a more considered, aware and ‘higher’ place, helping us to become more authentic towards ourselves and others.
In this talk Jennilee Toner shares her enthusiasm and passion for the 5 Yamas: Ahimsa (non-violence), Satya (Truthfulness), Asteya (Non-stealing), Brahmacharya (Moderation of the Senses) and Aparigraha (Greedlessness)

Learn more about all the 8 limbs in yoga in our 8 week guided online yoga practice, including talks, yoga, Pranayama and meditation classes! https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/t...

P9LQic302hg.title: Morning breath exercise to charge your energy system, with Esther Ekhart
P9LQic302hg.description:
This Pranayama exercise is part of the "Strong core - Radiant health" program on EkhartYoga. Inspired by Wim Hof, it will charge your body and energy system and open your mind.

Contraindications: If you have an existing medical condition (physical or mental health issues), please check with your doctor if deep breathing and breath retentions are suitable for you. If you are menstruating or are pregnant, skip the deep breathing, breath retentions and the cold shower.

pE-YLE4D73k.title: Half Moon to Sugarcane pose tutorial with Nichi Green

mfb9KzbrVeE.description:
This fun energising Vinyasa class is suitable for level 2 or intermediate practitioners. Think of your core like an apple core - from the top of your head to the tip of your tailbone. This is 30 minute sequence to awaken and strengthen the core of your being. Flexion, Extension, Lateral Flexion and Twisting poses included.

zC-izZtwjDY.title: 30 minute relaxing Hatha Yoga class, with Esther Ekhart
zC-izZtwjDY.description:
You might also like Esther's Day Retreat - https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/117/day-yoga-retreat-with-esther-ekhart which you can do for free during your trial!
Whenever you feel you need to relax and wind down, this all levels yoga sequence is for you. You can practice this in the evening, but also in the morning, or during a lunch break. Release tension from the hips and shoulders and rejuvenate with Legs up the wall pose at the end. Highly recommended if you want to slow down your mind and relax your body.

HtPKkNJcZMM.description:

He breaks Navasana into steps, showing some variations and practicing the swinging action to prepare you for your jump-back and jump-throughs, eventually coming up into Handstand.

8bPSP4ss-U0.title: Yoga Sun Salutations, modifications by Esther Ekhart
8bPSP4ss-U0.description:
Esther explains how to modify the Sun Salutations so it becomes safe to do 108 of them :-) Think of bending knees coming to and down from Mountain Pose. Cobra poses instead of Upward Facing Dog pose etc etc. As well you can decide to chant OHM 108 times or visualize, or do part of it. All explained in this video. Please watch when you are planning to follow our program! http://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/108-sun-salutations-challenge

ThbVxUM0iic.title: Legs and Butt Fix
ThbVxUM0iic.description:
Class 1 of the 'Yoga for strong body' program - http://bit.ly/1xlW0JQ. Strengthen your leg muscles and buttock muscles in this 10 minute workout. Often the lower buttock muscles and the area just around the sit bones are under used in yoga, causing lower back pain, sacroiliac instability etc.. So besides your buttocks shaping up nicely there is real benefit in working this area properly. Find the full program here: http://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/strong-body

fz0-zWexRrU.title: Yoga for better sleep, Part 1
fz0-zWexRrU.description:
Join Esther for 10 minutes just before you go to bed. This is class one from the yoga for better sleep program https://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/10/yoga-for-better-sleep 
We set the intention to clear our heads and body before we go to bed. It is so important to go to bed relaxed and calm. Your sleep will be of another quality and your next day will start already from a better place. It is helpful if you are ready to hop into bed, right after this practice! Enjoy your sleep.... Props needed: a bolster, pillows, blocks..
Become an EkhartYoga member!

ofTmQ4UF170.description:
http://www.EkhartYoga.com Strengthen your Wrists, Yoga with Esther Ekhart. Being on all fours for a period of time and using your hands and alignment of the arms the right way helps you to slowly but surely strengthen your wrists, arms and upper body. If you find yoga classes hard because of the many downward facing dogs, planks and chaturanga in them, then this is for you!

-w039vbRV_E.description:
http://www.EkhartYoga.com Yoga Lotus Pose Explained. If you are not sure whether you are able to perform Padmasana (Lotus posture) just try the half lotus first. Once we have a steady Padmasana we can move into Tittibhasana, where the emphasis is on the lift from deep within the abdomen. A wonderful energizer with the strong abdominal breath. sYrk42gkH9Y.title: Protect your wrists when doing Yoga
sYrk42gkH9Y.description:
https://www.EkhartYoga.com Protect your wrists when doing Yoga.
Learn how to stabilise your arms and shoulders and to protect your wrists when you're practicing yoga. This will help to prevent injuries and strengthens your wrists and hands for poses like Downward Dog, Chaturanga, Plank and arm balances like Crow pose and Handstands.

jvxNbHFCXrQ.title: Stretch your Legs Increase your Breath, Yoga with Sandra
jvxNbHFCXrQ.description:
http://www.EkhartYoga.com Stretch your Legs Increase your Breath, Yoga with Sandra Your breathing is affected by how open your inner thighs are. To find out more read Sandra's article: http://www.ekhartyoga.com/blog/opening-the-inner-thighs
Tightness in the adductors (inner thighs) reduces the capacity for a full and deep breath.  In this short sequence, work on standing poses to open the insides of your legs and increase your breath. With Prasarita Padottasana (Wide legged standing forward bend), Utkatasana (Chair pose) Malasana (Squat)

hGqp8hzxgRQ.title: Training the Mind, a Meditation with Esther Ekhart
hGqp8hzxgRQ.description:
https://www.EkhartYoga.com Training the mind a Meditation with Esther Ekhart you can do when you experience strong emotions.
We all know it is good to train the body, the same goes for the mind. You can train the mind, so it will stabilize and strengthen. This will greatly improve your quality of life. 
If you want to go on any kind of journey—not just a spiritual one but also a secular one, such as studying or doing business—you need a mind that is workable. You need a mind that you can rely on. Meditation helps to make the mind workable and reliable so it can do whatever it needs to do.

10GJpcEDqO8.title: Yoga Detox Warrior flow with Esther Ekhart
10GJpcEDqO8.description:
Yoga Detox Warrior flow. Feel strong and fresh in the New year through building up your leg and core strength with Warrior poses. We flow from Warrior I to a Warrior I variation with a forward bend to Warrior III and we repeat. This little flow will challenge and build up your stability, balance and strength. Repeat every day till it comes easy, then you know something in your stability and strength will have changed for the better.  :-)

0Lw00rODB9w.title: Pregnancy and Post Natal Yoga, Cow Face Pose
0Lw00rODB9w.description:
https://www.EkhartYoga.com Francesca Giusti shows us how a complex posture like Cow Face Pose or Go Mukhasana can actually bring benefits during pregnancy. The gentle stretch of the back of the pelvis can be quite soothing in case of sacroiliac joint issue. However, this posture is better known as a post natal asana, as it can help the tissues around the lower pelvis to come back to their former shape. Do not attempt this posture if you feel pain in your knees.

MKKvCQ-nX5U.title: Grounding with your Arms, Yoga
MKKvCQ-nX5U.description:
http://www.EkhartYoga.com Strength comes not just from muscle power. It comes more easily and effortlessly when we understand how the force of gravity moves through the  structure of our body. This is a little example of how our hands can actively connect with the earth and in return allowing the impulse we receive from it through the arms then into our centre. Useful in downward facing dogs and all other poses in which hands are on the floor. See more yoga with Aki Omori at http://ekhartyoga.com

mPqfZc-QFuQ.description:
https://www.EkhartYoga.com A short yoga sequence to strengthen the abs and core. For beginners as well as advanced. This yoga practice is to stabilize the deeper core muscles at the back of the belly. Strong inner core muscles make a huge difference in your life and will make your yoga practice go deeper, yoga poses will be better accessible. Do this for two weeks and you will have a different body!

dmTxQWZK9Xo.title: Short Destressing Yoga Practice for New Parents
dmTxQWZK9Xo.description:
http://www.EkhartYoga.com Busy parents often need Yoga more than anyone, but can't find the time for it.This is a very short Hatha Yoga class, followed by a relaxation. 

Running a busy home, lifting children and shoppings does take it's toll on the body, but also on the mind.
In this Yoga class we stretch the body and open up to create space. We focus on the breath to de-stress the mind. The poses in this yoga sequence are forward bends, backbends and a few twists to release tension in the arms and shoulders.
The yoga practice ends with a lovely 3 minute relaxation, make sure you do that as well, it will make all the difference!

For more short Yoga classes please go to: http://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/get-fit-and-healthy-in-10-days

To see more of Netmums please go to https://www.youtube.com/user/netmumschannel

nYa2VrX5Ls4.title: Yoga Pose: Supta Padangustasana / Reclining Big Toe Pose
nYa2VrX5Ls4.description:
http://www.ekhartyoga.com Supta Padangustasana / Reclining Big Toe Pose is a great pose for lower back pain. This yoga pose can relieve tension and compression and stretches the hamstrings safely. It can re-align the pelvic floor! Aki Omori has her special way of practicing this pose through integrating the leg into the core and the core into the leg.
Enjoy the many benefits of this yoga pose in this short online yoga class.

More about Aki : http://www.ekhartyoga.com/teachers/aki-omori

PgQaILIiyO0.title: Yoga twists to release tension in the back
PgQaILIiyO0.description:
This 10 minute class of gentle yoga twists will help you release tension in the mid/upper back - areas where we can typically store tension that causes back pain.
We focus on keeping length in the spine as we move into seated twists:
like: 
→ Marichyasana C:  http://bit.ly/2J6Ekid
→ Half lord of the Fishes pose: http://bit.ly/2xbMIHB

You can use this yoga sequences at the start of the day and feel the difference ☀️

For more yoga classes for back pain visit EkhartYoga https://www.ekhartyoga.com/articles/practice/10-yoga-classes-for-back-pain

#yoga #backpain #freeyoga #backpainrelief

BW15pLTtEe4.title: Morning Yoga Sequence, Lunge to Trikonasana Transition
BW15pLTtEe4.description:
http://www.EkhartYoga.com This is a lovely short sequence you can do at home to start your day in the morning. Introduce this transition between two classical postures, Trikonasana and Lunge, into your daily yoga practice. Doing at least 3 repetitions will create heat and strength. Build up to more to develop your practice and to coordinate your breath with your movement. By Francesca Giusti.

DX_2g1dPivI.title: September Yoga Month with Ekhart Yoga
DX_2g1dPivI.description:
Ekhart Yoga is celebrating September Yoga Month by offering 3 online Yoga classes per week (between 30-90 minutes) for free during the month of September which you can find at http://www.ekhartyoga.com/programs/september-yoga-month.

Each week will have one specific theme, like standing poses, twists, hips and hamstrings and heart opening postures. 

On YouTube http://www.youtube.com/yogatic we will upload one shorter yoga practice each week  around that theme, starting Monday September 3rd. 
These classes will get you ready for the Global "Time for Yoga" event. 

We will wrap up the Yoga month on September 30th with a global "Time for Yoga" class at 7pm your local time. The last free class I provide in week 4. Many yogis around the world will be joining you in your 90 min Yoga practice, everybody starts their practice at 7Pm their local time.  

Looking forward to see you all there,
Esther

http://www.ekhartyoga.com
You can stay up to date about it all on my facebook page http://www.facebook.com/EkhartYoga . 
Daily updates on twitter http://www.twitter.com/EkhartYoga

3jV6jprL3QE.title: Yoga, Knee Injury and Knee Health
3jV6jprL3QE.description:
https://www.ekhartyoga.com Knee health is an important topic in Yoga. If done wrong, Yoga could cause knee injuries, when you know how to protect your knees and create optimal alignment Yoga can help heal your knees. So have a look at this yoga video to hear what Esther has to say about preventing an injury and how to approach your yoga practice to keep the knees healthy!

6RHz_4DuFEM.title: Chaturanga Dandasana, Yoga
6RHz_4DuFEM.description:
https://www.EkhartYoga.com How to build up to Chaturanga Dandasana or Four Limbed Staff Pose in easy steps.This Yoga Pose comes up a lot in particularly flow Yoga classes. It is usually part of a Vinyasa yoga flow coming down from Plank Pose and before flowing into Upward Facing Dog Pose or Cobra Pose. A common yoga pose and a real yoga workout in itself. It will strengthen your arms and abs.

To learn more on the Four limbed staff pose check out this link for a step by step instruction:
http://www.ekhartyoga.com/everything-yoga/yoga-poses/four-limbed-staff-pose

http://www.EkhartYoga.com 2nd part of "yoga flow avoiding down dog and chaturanga". In this flow we will move on with standing poses, how to do them still creating some heat in the body, without having to take a vinyasa in between. Of course you can keep going with the different standing poses this way, than moving on to some seated asana's and lying poses to finish it off.. 6FOgShtDejE.title: Headstand Tutorial, Yoga
6FOgShtDejE.description:
https://www.EkhartYoga.com Esther Ekhart shows us a safe and easy way into the headstand.Try this pose after doing the warming up in the previous video. Do it under the guidance of a teacher the first time :-) Just to make sure your alignment is good. Its always ok to try this against a wall, making sure there is NO WEIGHT on the head, all in the arms! So you cannot harm your neck due to alignment issues if you are not sure. Have fun trying...

S27X9HCEIfQ.description:
https://www.EkhartYoga.com A yoga tutorial to prevent shoulder injury when doing staff pose, Chaturanga Dandasanana (also called Four limbed staff pose).

iJ6Mc2VHqks.title: Restorative Yoga Poses
iJ6Mc2VHqks.description:
http://www.EkhartYoga.com Two great restorative yoga poses, and some ideas what you can do with your blocks! . A variation of supported baddha konasana and a variation of vipariti karani.

I like doing them towards the end of class, but certainly the first pose, supported bound angle pose can also be done at the beginning of class. Even do them by themselves to give yourself a treat.

Please comment how you feel after doing these and what use you would use them for, or if you have other creative ideas of how you can use yoga blocks!

I like doing them towards the end of class, but certainly the first pose, supported bound angle pose can also be done at the beginning of class. Even do them by themselves to give yourself a treat.

Please comment how you feel after doing these and what use you would use them for, or if you have other creative ideas of how you can use yoga blocks!

ppToA1N0CgE.title: Yoga for Opening the Shoulders
ppToA1N0CgE.description:
Please sign up to my newsletter for free classes, EkhartYoga news and offers: https://www.ekhartyoga.com/newsletter-signup
This yoga sequence with Esther Ekhart helps to release tight shoulders and chest and eases upper back pain. It's great to do if you sit at a desk all day! Especially when working from home at a laptop.
It will also improve mobility in your shoulders and upper back for backbends.
Inspired by Eric Schiffmann: www.movingintostillness.com
